intro: Lithocarpus tenuinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined stone栎, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its leathery, elliptical leaves with a prominent midrib and fine veins. Its fruit is a hard, one-seeded nut enclosed in a cupule, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
